text:
Securitization has led to financial innovation that allows investors to invest in
securities that better match their preferred risk, maturity, and return characteristics.
As an example, an investor with a long investment horizon can invest in a portfolio
of long-term mortgage loans rather than in only bank bonds, deposits, or equities.
The investor can gain exposure to long-term mortgages without having the
specialized resources and expertise necessary to provide loan origination and loan
servicing functions.
Securitization provides diversification and risk reduction compared to purchasing
individual loans (whole loans).
